footer.title: About us
footer.text: Archetype is not a simple typology of personality, but it is an opportunity to better understand yourself.
footer.span: Our young team developed this project in collaboration with a psychologist so that you can learn about your unique traits and determine your career or education path and learn about your deep values.

sectionWhatForArchetypes.title: Why should you know your archetype ?
sectionWhatForArchetypes.subtitle: Knowledge about archetypes helps you stay happy with every aspect of your life from self-realization to relationships
sectionWhatForArchetypes.descriptionCard1: Archetypes give clear understanding of your strengths and weaknesses, answer the questions where to take motivation and resources, and also highlight your life strategy
sectionWhatForArchetypes.descriptionCard2: Knowing your own characteristics and noticing the characteristics of others, you can learn to build effective and enjoyable communication with family, friends, boss and even strangers.
sectionWhatForArchetypes.descriptionCard3: Archetypes help to identify and unblock your unrealized values. Integrating the values of archetypes into life helps to live it at full and feel satisfaction.
sectionWhatForArchetypes.descriptionCard4: Archetypes are a set of parameters, values and even visual solutions. If you know your archetypes, then you understand how to broadcast yourself organically in work, blog and life.

sectionAboutArchetypes.SectionDescription: Archetypes are a multidimensional and deep typology of personality. With the help of archetypes you can look into the deepest parts of a soul, get acquainted with their light and shadow qualities, realize their value and strength.

introduction.text: If you have been looking for answers to your questions for a long time, but still do not understand who you'd like to be when you grow up, then archetypes will help you put all the dots above the “i”
introduction.headline: Find out your archetype

Innocent.title: Innocent
Innocent.subtitle1: help people to find their happines
Innocent.subtitle5: let others feel the lightness and serenity around him

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Innocent is the easiest and the most optimistic type. We can say that it is the image of an eternal child that enjoys a moment, flight of fancy and is constantly surprised. Representatives of this archetype more often than others need care and support.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: Representatives of this type in stress become capricious child in the literal sense of the word. The innocent begins to show attention to himself and attracts attention, while not paying attention to the needs of people nearby

Esthete.title: Esthete
Esthete.subtitle5: get results by relations with others

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: For an esthete, first of all, comfort and enjoyment of life are important. Esthetes are noble hedonists, they know how to brightly present themselves and create comfort. By right, this type can be called the most emotional, striving for intimacy and contact with other people. Beauty and aesthetics for this type is of key importance.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: An esthete in stress is a 'drama queen' and a noble manipulator. There is impulsiveness in actions and decisions.

Glorious Small.title: Good fellow
Glorious Small.subtitle1: be a worthy part of society

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Good fellow is on good terms with any company. It is easy to find a common language with him and in communication you quickly get the impression that you have known this person all your life. Good fellow cares how others treat him, so he will do a lot to please people and meet the expectations of others.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: Good fellow under stress often doubts himself and loses confidence. The worst thing for him is to lose the favor of his comrades and find himself in center of a scandal or conflict. In such situation, good fellow will do everything to restore his good name. Without his environment, a nice fellow quickly withers and may lose interest in the world around him. Contact with people will help to recover.

Jester.title: Jester
Jester.subtitle5: getting attention through vivid images and emotions

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Jester is the main merry fellow in any company. With the help of humor, jokes and practical jokes, this type sets others in a positive way. Next to jester is rarely boring, he knows how to create a holiday atmosphere and entertain others.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: The dark side of jester is often shown in black humor and banter. In stress jester loses his optimism, which is replaced by gloomy realism and anger at the world. In this state, jester can set others against each other, for fun, weave intrigues. He can lead a faucet cheeky lifestyle and lose all his former optimism.

Ruler.title: Ruler
Ruler.subtitle5: manage others, achieve results through authority

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Ruler is a bright leader and one who leads. Such people are often independent, self-confident and like to take responsibility. Born leader and manager. Rulers love everything related to status, achievements and results, they are not shy to show themselves in all their glory.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: Under stress ruler becomes authoritarian and even somewhat tyrannical. He loses the ability to hear others and gets hung up on his own rightness. Ruler can be cruel in judgments and actions, impulsive and categorical. Rulers tend to divide people into friends and foes, feel superior to those who are weaker and constantly compete with their peers, but not always honestly.

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Seeker is a person in constant search for opportunities, change and freedom. This person is not always a traveler, a seeker can look for himself in the inner world, in a career or relationships, but the basis is unchanged that is change and movement forward. This is the most freedom-loving archetype, limits and commitment hinder its potential.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: The worst thing that can happen to a seeker is loss of personal freedom and ability to move on. Seeker can get stuck in an endless search for insights and impressions, but still not find himself. For seeker, implementation and progress are important, but resources are often limited. Therefore, seeker needs to learn to stop sometimes and rest in order to correct his further movement.

Rebel.title: Rebel
Rebel.subtitle5: go against a system to change something

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Often a rebel can be recognized by his willingness to enter into an argument and go against a system. These are people who hit and then apologize. This world needs rebels to update systems, break stereotypes and bring something new into the lives of others.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: The whole life of a rebel is a conditional stress. It is not typical for a rebel to rest. Rebels are people of action, especially at a critical moment. When everything around is well-organized, nothing new is promised and there is nothing to fight against, a rebel loses his enthusiasm and can fall into depression or he will start a revolution where it is not needed now. If the current situation does not allow a rebel to show his qualities, then you need to learn how to 'walk' your rebel in other areas of life.

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: The comfortable environment for the hero is the battlefield, and the main task is to fight. It is almost impossible for a hero to sit idle. The hero is always ready to sacrifice himself, his time and resources in order to prove his strength and competence. Dedication and devotion to the idea is also characteristic of the heroes. Heroes love competition, for them it is a good resource to move forward to new heights.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: The comfortable environment for a hero is a battlefield and the main task is to fight. It is almost impossible for a hero to sit idle. A hero is always ready to sacrifice himself, his time and resources in order to prove his strength and competence. Dedication and devotion to the idea is also characteristic of heroes. Heroes love competition. For them it is a good resource to move forward to new heights.

Guardian.title: Guardian
Guardian.subtitle4: neglecting oneself for the sake of others
Guardian.subtitle5: help others move to another level

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: A guardian in comfort is a person who is ready to help, shelter, warm and teach something new. Caring flows in the blood of guardians. It is important to understand that guardians with their care can reveal a person, his potential and give impetus to development. Guardians know how to make this world kinder.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: If a guardian does not receive gratitude for his work and care for a long time, he can become tough and strict. He can punish others by depriving his care and protection, thereby making the offender helpless. An underestimated guardian can explode at one fine moment and a kind, understanding person will be replaced by a tyrant demanding retribution for his labors and hardships. Also, under stress, caregivers can become completely out of touch with their own needs and completely dissolve into others.

Sage.title: Sage
Sage.subtitle4: immersion in yourself, weak empathy, alienation
Sage.subtitle5: bring knowledge into this world and eradicate ignorance

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: A wise man can be recognized by a slightly detached look, speech seasoned with terminology and a love of philosophical conversations. Representatives of this archetype are often harmless and a little eccentric, can go into fantasies and endlessly learn something new. Curiosity and insightful mind make them interesting conversationalists, but companies will always prefer loneliness.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: A wise man can go deep into himself and constantly analyze and calculate options for development of events. Sometimes in his reasoning he can go deep into the world of concepts and fantasies, and lose touch with reality. In this state, the sage can be annoyed by any manifestation of emotions, both his own and those around him. Also, a sage can be extremely intolerant of superficiality and stupidity of people.

Mage.title: Magician
Mage.subtitle1: make your dreams come true and reach a new level
Mage.subtitle3: ability to see hidden trends, intuition
Mage.subtitle5: to see what is inaccessible to others, reveal secret knowledge

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Magician is one of the most mysterious archetypes. Often, when you contact him, you get the impression that you are in contact with something unearthly, not completely understandable and kindly strange. Magicians easily notice hidden trends and pitfalls in any communication. Often these are gray cardinals that act on intuition and through other people.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: A magician under stress, like a sage, can dive deep into himself and explore the causal relationships of events. Often magicians feel 'out of the party' and out of place: they doubt themselves and there is a feeling of rejection by others, a feeling of loneliness in the crowd. He can be vindictive and manipulative.

Creator.title: Creator
Creator.subtitle5: constant search for inspiration and a non-standard approach

paragraph1.title: COMFORT
paragraph1.text: Creators are innovators, for them standard and ordinary things are simply boring. Creative people can rarely hold interest within limits and rules, and often live by inspiration rather than by schedule. It is important for creators to be special, stand out from the crowd and show their talent.

paragraph2.title: STRESS
paragraph2.text: The worst thing for a creator is to get stuck in dullness and lose a source of his endless ideas. At such moments, a creator can become boring and caustic. If a creator was underestimated or he was disappointed in his talent, then he may be offended, fall into a stupor and stop his activity until a new idea appears that the creator believes in.

sectionFindOut.title: Find out your archetype
sectionFindOut.subtitle: This small test will help you learn about your leading archetypes, identify your values and strengths.

block1.title: First block
block1.text: Choose an answer that suits you the best from the two suggested below
block1.question2: I am a very curious and spontaneous person
block1.question3: I am often fascinated and admired
block1.question4: I can get along with anyone
block1.question5: With a new friend, I quickly become on the same wavelength
block1.question6: I can be the center of any company
block1.question7: I know how to enjoy life
block1.question8: I like to flirt and make new friends
block1.question9: People are attracted to me and my energy
block1.question10: I love to laugh heartily and have a good time
block1.question11: I can easily laugh at myself
block1.question12: I like to gather people around me and entertain them with stories
block1.question13: I am an active and energetic person
block1.question14: I easily perceive new ideas and opportunities
block1.question15: I am positive about life changes
block1.question16: I can easily take responsibility for others
block1.question17: I like to control and manage people
block1.question18: I don't accept compromises, I live by the principle of 'all or nothing'
block1.question19: I like to break the rules and be against the system
block1.question20: I am oppressed by clear boundaries and rules
block1.question21: I can express my opinion even if it causes resentment in others
block1.question22: I'm the winner in every situation
block1.question23: I like to overcome difficulties and obstacles
block1.question24: I can do what others can't
block1.question25: I like to study and discover new things
block1.question26: I can get so caught up in a question that I lose track of time
block1.question27: I like to dive deep into a topic and understand it 100%
block1.question28: I often play the role of the 'gray cardinal', I do not like to give direct orders
block1.question29: I am good at thinking strategically and being one step ahead.
block1.question30: I have a well-developed intuition and I trust my hunch
block1.question31: I love everything unusual and original
block1.question32: I consider myself a creative and imaginative person
block1.question34: I see hidden potential in other people
block1.question35: I know how to reveal a person and support him
block1.question36: I enjoy helping and caring for others

block2.title: Second block
block2.text: Choose a picture, which you like the most
block2.question: Choose a picture, which you like the most

block3.title: Third block
block3.text: Choose an answer that suits you the best from the five suggested below
block3.question1: It's hard for me to sit in one place for a long time
block3.question2: I often change my environment, activities and hobbies
block3.question3: I'm all in search of ideas, opportunities, impressions
block3.question4: It is important for me to have influence and authority
block3.question6: I easily manage to take a leadership position in a team
block3.question7: I can turn upside down any idea or concept
block3.question8: I often feel 'out of place' and break usual rules
block3.question9: I don't like being like everyone else
block3.question10: I am ready to achieve a result at any cost
block3.question11: Difficulties do not frighten me, but only motivate me even more
block3.question12: Result is more important than process
block3.question13: I am on good terms with any company
block3.question14: It is important for me to find common ground with other people
block3.question15: I do not like to attract too much attention
block3.question16: I know how to enjoy little things
block3.question17: I am easily touched or impressed
block3.question18: I am an optimistic and carefree person
block3.question19: Comfort plays an important role for me in choosing a partner, activity or home
block3.question20: I always try to look good and admire good people like me
block3.question21: I know how to attract attention to myself and keep interest of an interlocutor
block3.question22: There is nothing better than laughing heartily in good company
block3.question23: I am always in a good mood and I know how to infect others
block3.question24: I am very pleased when I manage to bring a smile to face of a interlocutor
block3.question25: I love learning and gaining new knowledge
block3.question26: It gives me pleasure to understand a complex topic and find the truth
block3.question27: I tend to think long and hard about the solution
block3.question28: Usually my ideas are creative and innovative
block3.question29: I often experiment with style, ideas, way of life
block3.question30: It is very difficult for me to follow restrictions and fit into a framework
block3.question31: I can easily see hidden relationships in events and systems
block3.question32: I trust my feelings and intuition to make important decisions
block3.question33: My actions are often illogical, but I know exactly what to do
block3.question34: I feel people deeply and I know how to empathize
block3.question35: I like helping others and being helpful
block3.question36: Next to me, a person quickly reveals his best qualities and gets inspired

resultPage.subtitle: Find out which of your archetypes is the most developed
